title: BELLAMY, Sister Laurette Jun 27, 1927 - Feb 9, 2024
text:
ST. MARY-OF-THE-WOODS - Sister Laurette Bellamy died on Feb. 9, 2024, in Mother Theodore Hall, St. Mary-of-the-Woods.
She was born on June 27, 1927 in Chicago, IL to Harold and Loretta Burke Bellamy and was baptized Yvonne Marie.
Sister Laurette entered the Congrega- tion of the Sisters of Providence on Feb. 2, 1948 and professed Final Vows Aug. 15, 1955. She earned a bachelor's degree from St. Mary-of-the-Woods College, a master's degree from Catholic University of America and a PhD from Indiana University, all in music.
Of her 76 years as a Sister of Providence, she ministered as a teacher of music 46 years in Indiana schools. She was on the music faculty of Saint Mary-of-the-Woods College 1952-53, 1955-57, 1968-71 and 1972-2003. She then retired from full-time teaching but continued as adjunct faculty at SMWC for another seven years.
In 2005, she began giving volunteer service to local agencies, first in Terre Haute and then in Bloomington, Indianapolis and Greenwood. Beginning in 2023, she committed herself totally to the ministry of prayer.
Sister Laurette was warmly welcoming, always gracious, and incredibly humorous. She was a music scholar of the first order, highly respected and loved by her students. In her last years, she was involved with the Providence Associate relationship, mentoring many new members.
Sister is preceded in death by her sister, Dr. Carol Bellamy-Vaughan.
She is survived by a brother-in-law, Robert Vaughn of Santa Monica, CA; nieces and nephew, Jennifer Vaughn of Vancouver, BC, Adrienne (Steve) Bates-Brown of Greenwood, IN, and Stephen (Ana) Bates of Vienna, VA; and great-nieces and nephews, Craig Vaughn, Sienna Bates. and Avery, Allison and Julian Brown.
The wake is on Feb. 26, from 2:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. in the Church of the Immaculate Conception with the Wake Service at 4:30 p.m. The Mass of Christian Burial is on Feb. 27 at 11:00 a.m. with Reverend Ron Ashmore presiding. Burial is in the cemetery of the Sisters of Providence.
DeBaun Funeral Homes and Crematory assisted with arrangements.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Sisters of Providence, 1 Sisters of Providence, St. Mary-of-the-Woods, IN. 47876.

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
